summary: Almost 6 million people living in Hawaii, Alaska, Puerto Rico, and other noncontiguous U.S. lands depend on ships to deliver goods from the mainland. U.S. policy encourages reasonable shipping rates, and the Surface Transportation Board can determine reasonableness. The Board can start a review of shipping rates itself or in response to complaints. It has 3 methods for determining whether a rate is reasonable. Those...
title: Domestic Oceangoing Shipping: Information on the Surface Transportation Board's Regulatory Processes
